Cherrycake\Modules\DatabaseProvider::prepareAndExecuteCache

prepareAndExecuteCache

Performs a full prepared query procedure in just one call with Cache capabilities. Does the same as if we're executing prepare and execute methods separaterly. Intended for performing prepared queries that won't be repeated in a loop (thus we don't need the benefits of separately preparing the query and then executing it multiple times with different values). Intended to be overloaded.

    Signature

    public function prepareAndExecuteCache(string $sql, array $parameters, [boolean $cacheTtl = false, [boolean $cacheKeyNamingOptions = false, [boolean $overrideCacheProviderName = false, [boolean $isStoreInCacheWhenNoResults = true, [boolean $setup = false]]]]] )

    Parameters

    $sql — string
    The SQL sentence to prepare to be queried to the database.
    $parameters — array
    Hash array of the variables that must be applied to the prepared query in order to execute the final query, in the same order as are stated on the prepared sql. Same syntax as in the execute method.
    $cacheTtl — boolean
    The TTL for the cache results. If not specified, configuration value cacheDefaultTtl is used
    $cacheKeyNamingOptions — boolean
    If specified, takes the configuration keys as specified in \Cherrycake\Modules\Cache::buildCacheKey
    $overrideCacheProviderName — boolean
    The name of the alternative cache provider to use for this query. If specified, it will use this cache provider (as configured in cache.config.php) instead of the one configured in database.config.php
    $isStoreInCacheWhenNoResults — boolean
    Whether to store results in the cache when the query returned no rows or not
    $setup — boolean
    Optional array with additional options, See DatabaseResult::init for available options

    Returns

    DatabaseResult
    A provider-specific DatabaseResult object if the query has been executed correctly, false otherwise.
